issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When one mis-types a networking mode in eucalyptus.conf, the NC starts, logs an error, and continues running, logging an unhelpful/unrelated error message every time the CC polls it.  It should log that error and terminate instead so people immediately know something is wrong.

Unless, of course, we decide to support changing networking modes without restarting the process, anyway.
fields.summary: NC starts when an invalid VNET_MODE is specified

comments.body: It appears both the CC and NC default to SYSTEM mode if the VNET_MODE is incorrect, so the system does show some sort of life. The cc-fault and nc-fault logs will give a indication of the mal-function.

Create a new fault : 1012, for CC and NC when VNET_MODE is wrong.
See dev/jpdonnelly/EUCA-3958
[~juphoff], will you be able to perform this review for [~jdonnelly]?
You're logging EUCAFATAL in both cases (the CC and the NC), but you're not actually returning an initFail error, so this isn't actually EUCAFATAL. Seems EUCAERROR should be logged here, instead.
That, or initFail=1 should be set, and it should be a true fatal error.

Made suggested changes.


[jpdonnelly@b-11 internal]$ git push origin maint/3.2/testing
Counting objects: 3, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (2/2), done.
Writing objects: 100% (2/2), 289 bytes, done.
Total 2 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote:  INFO:SUBMODULE refs/heads/maint/3.2/testing/eucalyptus                       [  ok  ]
remote:  INFO:SUBMODULE refs/heads/maint/3.2/testing/lib                              [  ok  ]
remote:  INFO:SUBMODULE refs/heads/maint/3.2/testing/storage-san                      [  ok  ]
remote:  INFO:SUBMODULE refs/heads/maint/3.2/testing/vmware-broker                    [  ok  ]
To git+ssh://repo-euca@git.eucalyptus-systems.com/internal
   02e8c8b..6a5544a  maint/3.2/testing -> maint/3.2/testing
With the initFail=1 changes, this looks good.

This fix was mistakenly merged into 3.2's testing branch and got reverted, which means it's going to be reverted in mainline the next time 3.2 merges into mainline.  I'm re-opening this bug so we can reapply the change after that happens.

Commits reverted from maint/3.2/testing:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/b3f050bb61a3adcb97256e396a73818d02fa3b53

Added change to 3.3 testing:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/compare/73d2d193d7bf...097bdf7bba24
Thanks for getting this in the right place Matt.  Marking as In QA now for 3.3.0.

Nice fault in log now with bad value VNET_MODE = AGED-NOVLAN
{code}
************************************************************************
  ERR-1012 2013-05-22 19:18:27Z Subsystem failed with incorrect configuration item.

   Condition: VNET_MODE is set to an unknown mode.
       Cause: Invalid configuartion item detected in eucatyptus.conf file.
   Initiator: Eucalyptus
    Location: localhost
  Resolution: 

        Subsystem: nc, Cause: Invalid VNET_MODE setting: AGED-NOVLAN .

        The system network configuration on this node is not valid.

        1. Edit /etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf
        2. Set the VNET_MODE parameter to one of these values:
        	SYSTEM
        	STATIC
        	MANAGED
        	MANAGED_NOVLAN
        3. Start the Eucalyptus service on this node using the appropriate name:
        	On NC: 	service eucalyptus-nc restart
        	On CLC: service eucalyptus-cloud restart
        	On CC: 	service eucalyptus-cc cleanrestart
        4. Verify that the system comes back up and behaves as you expected.
        Please report any problems or post a question on https://engage.eucalyptus.com/
      
************************************************************************

{code}
